verses.verse: And there went<WH3212> a man<WH376> of the house<WH1004> of Levi<WH3878>, and took<WH3947> to wife a daughter<WH1323> of Levi<WH3878>.
And the woman<WH802> conceived<WH2029>, and bare<WH3205> a son<WH1121>: and when she saw<WH7200> him that he was a goodly<WH2896> child<WH6845>, she hid him three<WH7969> months<WH3391>.

And when she could<WH3201> not longer<WH5750> hide<WH6845> him<WH3947>, she took for him an ark<WH8392> of bulrushes<WH1573>, and daubed<WH2560> it with slime<WH2564> and with pitch<WH2203>; and she put<WH7760> the child<WH3206> therein<WH7760>, and laid it in the flags<WH5488> by the river<WH2975>'s brink<WH8193>.
And his sister<WH269> stood<WH3320> afar off<WH7350>, to know<WH3045> what would be done to him<WH6213>.

And the daughter<WH1323> of Pharaoh<WH6547> came down<WH3381> to bathe<WH7364> at the river<WH2975>; and her maidens<WH5291> walked<WH1980> along by the<WH2975> river-side<WH3027>; and she saw<WH7200> the ark<WH8392> among<WH8432> the flags<WH5488>, and sent<WH7971> her handmaid<WH519> to fetch it<WH3947>.

And she opened<WH6605> it<WH7200>, and saw the child<WH3206>: and<WH5288>, behold, the babe wept<WH1058>. And she had compassion<WH2550> on him<WH559>, and said, This is one of the Hebrews<WH5680>' children<WH3206>.

Then said<WH559> his sister<WH269> to Pharaoh<WH6547>'s daughter<WH1323>, Shall I go<WH3212> and call<WH7121> thee a nurse<WH3243> of the Hebrew<WH5680> women<WH802>, that she may nurse<WH3243> the child for thee<WH3206>?
And Pharaoh<WH6547>'s daughter<WH1323> said<WH559> to her<WH3212>, Go. And the maiden<WH5959> went<WH3212> and called<WH7121> the child<WH3206>'s mother<WH517>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547>'s daughter<WH1323> said<WH559> unto her<WH3212>, Take this child<WH3206> away<WH3212>, and nurse<WH3243> it for me<WH5414>, and I will give thee thy wages<WH7939>. And the woman<WH802> took<WH3947> the child<WH3206>, and nursed it<WH5134>.

And the child<WH3206> grew<WH1431>, and she brought<WH935> him unto Pharaoh<WH6547>'s daughter<WH1323>, and he became her son<WH1121>. And she called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Moses<WH4872>, and said<WH559>, Because I drew<WH4871> him out of the water<WH4325>.

And it came to pass in those days<WH3117>, when Moses<WH4872> was grown<WH1431> up<WH3318>, that he went out unto his brethren<WH251>, and looked<WH7200> on their burdens<WH5450>: and he saw<WH7200> an Egyptian<WH4713> smiting<WH5221> a Hebrew<WH5680>, one of his brethren<WH251>.
And he looked<WH6437> this way<WH3541> and that way<WH3541>, and when he saw<WH7200> that there was no man<WH376>, he smote<WH5221> the Egyptian<WH4713>, and hid<WH2934> him in the sand<WH2344>.

And he went out<WH3318> the second<WH8145> day<WH3117>, and<WH8147>, behold, two men<WH582> of the Hebrews<WH5680> were striving<WH5327> together<WH559>: and he said to him that did the wrong<WH7563>, Wherefore smitest<WH5221> thou thy fellow<WH7453>?

And he said<WH559>, Who made<WH7760> thee<WH376> a prince<WH8269> and a judge<WH8199> over us<WH559>? Thinkest thou to kill<WH2026> me<WH2026>, as thou killedst the Egyptian<WH4713>? And Moses<WH4872> feared<WH3372>, and said<WH559>, Surely<WH403> the thing<WH1697> is known<WH3045>.

Now when Pharaoh<WH6547> heard<WH8085> this thing<WH1697>, he sought<WH1245> to slay<WH2026> Moses<WH4872>. But Moses<WH4872> fled<WH1272> from the face<WH6440> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, and dwelt<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Midian<WH4080>: and he sat down<WH3427> by a well<WH875>.

Now the priest<WH3548> of Midian<WH4080> had seven<WH7651> daughters<WH1323>: and they came<WH935> and drew<WH1802> water<WH4390>, and filled the troughs<WH7298> to water<WH8248> their father<WH1>'s flock<WH6629>.
And the shepherds<WH7462> came<WH935> and drove them away<WH1644>; but Moses<WH4872> stood up<WH6965> and helped<WH3467> them<WH8248>, and watered their flock<WH6629>.
And when they came<WH935> to Reuel<WH7467> their father<WH1>, he said<WH559>, How<WH4069> is it that ye are come<WH935> so soon<WH4116> to-day<WH3117>?

And they said<WH559>, An Egyptian<WH4713> delivered<WH5337> us out of the hand<WH3027> of the shepherds<WH7462>, and moreover he drew<WH1802> water<WH1802> for us<WH8248>, and watered the flock<WH6629>.
And he said<WH559> unto his daughters<WH1323>, And where is he<WH5800>? Why is it that ye have left the man<WH376>? Call<WH7121> him<WH398>, that he may eat bread<WH3899>.
And Moses<WH4872> was content<WH2974> to dwell<WH3427> with the man<WH376>: and he gave<WH5414> Moses<WH4872> Zipporah<WH6855> his daughter<WH1323>.
And she bare<WH3205> a son<WH1121>, and he called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Gershom<WH1647>; for he said<WH559>, I have been a sojourner<WH1616> in a foreign<WH5237> land<WH776>.

And it came to pass in the course<WH1992> of those many days<WH3117>, that the king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> died<WH4191>: and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> sighed<WH584> by reason of<WH4480> the bondage<WH5656>, and they cried<WH2199>, and their cry<WH7775> came up<WH5927> unto God<WH430> by reason of the bondage<WH5656>.
And God<WH430> heard<WH8085> their groaning<WH5009>, and God<WH430> remembered<WH2142> his covenant<WH1285> with Abraham<WH85>, with Isaac<WH3327>, and with Jacob<WH3290>.
And God<WH430> saw<WH7200> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, and God<WH430> took knowledge of them<WH3045>.
